summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with an individual (referred to as III) conducted on January 14, 2020. The interviewee provides information about their sibling's (referred to as [REDACTED]) relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including details about meetings, travel, gifts, and eventual disclosures of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. Described as a 'godfather figure' to the interviewee's sibling, providing gifts, travel, and accommodations. The interviewee's sibling later disclosed being raped by him for years.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's girlfriend/partner. Present during meetings with the interviewee and their sibling. Allegedly referred to the sibling's friend as her 'slave' in front of Bill Clinton.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: The interviewee's sibling who had a relationship with Jeffrey Epstein starting around age 14. She received gifts, traveled to his properties, and later disclosed to a friend that she was raped by Epstein for years.

persons.name: III
persons.context: The individual being interviewed. They are the sibling of the alleged victim and provide second-hand information about their sibling's interactions with Epstein and Maxwell, as well as their own limited encounters.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the interviewee's sibling met at Mar-a-Lago around a certain time, with Epstein and Maxwell present.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the sibling's friend met with Ghislaine Maxwell present. Maxwell allegedly introduced the friend to Clinton as her 'slave'.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A friend of the victim who worked for Epstein and Maxwell, describing herself as Maxwell's 'slave'. She confirmed to the interviewee that she was unaware of Epstein's crimes and that the situation ruined her life.

connections.description: Epstein was a mentor/financial benefactor to the victim starting when she was approximately 14. She later disclosed she was raped by him for years.
Described as girlfriend/partner. They traveled together and were present during meetings with the victim and her family.
The friend described herself as Maxwell's assistant and 'slave'. Maxwell allegedly introduced her as such to Bill Clinton.
Friends. The victim confided in her friend about the abuse during a lunch, and the friend later discussed her work for Epstein/Maxwell with the interviewee.
The interviewee met Epstein a few times, spoke to him on the phone, received a computer gift, and once stayed in his New York apartment.

events.title: First Meeting at Interlochen
events.description: The victim first met Jeffrey Epstein at the Interlochen arts camp picnic tables when she was approximately 14 years old. She expressed admiration for him.

events.title: Stay at Epstein's Interlochen Cabin
events.description: The victim and her sibling (the interviewee) stayed at Epstein's cabin at Interlochen during the victim's second or third year at camp. Epstein was not present.

events.title: Meeting at Mar-a-Lago
events.description: The victim told the interviewee she met Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago, with Epstein and Maxwell present.

events.title: Disclosure of Abuse to Friend
events.description: The victim's friend took her to lunch, stated she knew the victim was raped, leading the victim to break down and confirm the abuse.

events.title: First Public Investigation
events.description: When news of the investigation into Epstein first broke, the victim subtly mentioned to the interviewee what had happened to her.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: The interviewee texted the victim after Jeffrey Epstein died, saying he was out of her life, but later realized the situation was 'just beginning'.

locations: New York City, New York (Epstein's seven-story house and apartment)
keyFacts: The victim was approximately 14 years old when she first met Jeffrey Epstein at the Interlochen arts camp.
The victim later disclosed to a friend, and subsequently to her sibling (the interviewee), that she was 'raped by a pedophile for years,' referring to Epstein.
Ghislaine Maxwell was present during many of the victim's interactions with Epstein and allegedly referred to another young female employee as her 'slave' in front of Bill Clinton.
Epstein provided significant financial support to the victim, including paying for her Interlochen tuition, giving gifts like a computer, and co-signing a lease.
The interview reveals the grooming process, where Epstein was initially seen as a benevolent 'godfather figure' before the abusive nature of the relationship was revealed.
